meta.title: NRI Taxation in India: Rules, Income Sources, and Compliance
meta.description: Understand how Non-Resident Indians are taxed in India and how to stay compliant with Indian tax laws.
meta.author: CA Rahul Mehta

sections.content: NRI taxation depends on residential status and income earned or received in India. Proper planning helps avoid double taxation.
An individual is considered an NRI if they stay in India for less than 182 days during a financial year.
DTAA agreements help NRIs avoid paying tax twice on the same income.
